title: Chinese space firm raises funds for commercial weather data satellite constellation
summary: Chinese private company wants to build a constellation of 80 satellites to provide weather data, further illustrating the growth and scope of China’s commercial space sector.

title: Virgin Galactic again delays start of commercial suborbital flights
summary: Virgin Galactic has once again pushed back the start of commercial flights of its SpaceShipTwo suborbital spaceplane, saying upgrades of its carrier aircraft are taking longer than expected.

title: NASA and Roscosmos officials restate intent to operate ISS after 2024
summary: NASA and Roscosmos reiterated that they expect to continue operations of the International Space Station after 2024 as NASA continues to push for an extension to 2030.

title: SpaceX launches Danuri, South Korea’s first mission to the Moon
summary: SpaceX has launched South Korea’s first mission to the Moon on Thursday. A flight-proven Falcon 9 rocket launched the Danuri spacecraft from Space Launch Complex 40 at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida at 7:08 PM EDT (23:08 UTC).

title: China launches secretive reusable test spacecraft
summary: China sent a highly-classified reusable experimental spacecraft into orbit Thursday, two years after a similarly clandestine mission.
